e4: Despite some investors potentially misunderstanding the new policy, transparency and honest reporting of actual profits seem preferable to intentionally overstating EPS and risking exposure to regulatory or reputational risk. Implementing an unbiased methodology also brings ABC in line with generally accepted accounting principles and helps safeguard its image over time. By adopting a new, no-bias policy, ABC company could enjoy heightened confidence, clarity in management decisions, and reduced liability potential under SEC stipulations by ensuring accountability on every reported EPS figure that aligns true financial information.
e5: An ethical reporting policy involves honest disclosure of accurate financial information. It avoids intentional misrepresentation, ensures consistency in data and reporting, adheres to established accounting practices, prioritizes transparency, and recognizes the value of public trusts built through clear and truthful communication between organizations (reporters like companies) like XYZ and their investors who form a symbiotic relationships.
e6: Why haven't you changed to a unbiased reporting policy earlier despite concerns arising from potential misuse, considering some funds may profit at the expense of retail investors when financial information discrepancies arise during or if adjustments to this accounting style occur?
